6442b480-e0f6-4269-8978-641f4ba2e496.description: The K-8 PAsmart Targeted Grant cohort is an evidence-based professional learning pathway that includes six days of facilitated, in-person professional learning as well as twelve hours of embedded online learning.
6442b480-e0f6-4269-8978-641f4ba2e496.name: PASMART TARGETED GRANT PDE K-8 PATHWAY

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Access, use, and demonstrate knowledge of the K-12 Computer Science Framework and Computer Science Teachers Association Standards.
Demonstrate the need for computer science as a core educational literacy and as a driver of innovation in our communities.
Design, initiate and reflect on a small-scale implementation pilot .

Recognize and create a plan to close equity gaps in computer science education, specifically for students with disabilities and other historically underrepresented populations, such as students of color, English language learners and female students.
Leverage community and stakeholder partnerships to accelerate computer science learning experiences for every learner.

efb7a2e4-0782-4cff-a2d3-4e0bef8218b6.description: Teaching through a concrete-representation-abstract (CRA) sequence of instruction supports students’ learning of mathematical concepts and procedures. The CRA sequencing of instruction is an evidence-based instructional practice (Gersten et al, 2009; NMAP, 2008; Riccomini & Witzel, 2010; Witzel 2005). This badge is award to educators that complete PaTTAN's coursework preparing them to implement a CRA sequence of instruction for whole number addition and subtraction algorithms.
efb7a2e4-0782-4cff-a2d3-4e0bef8218b6.name: CRA: Addition & Subtraction

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PaTTAN's CRA: Addition and Subtraction course. To find available offerings, check out the PaTTAN training calendar.

0e681291-a7d4-48ac-9d59-3155e413c80a.description: The badge holder has demonstrated computer science (CS) knowledge and competencies necessary for 7-12 CS educators, as evidenced by their achievement of a passing score on the 7-12 CS certification exam. Announced by the Pennsylvania Department of Education in December, 2020, the 7-12 CS certification exam is administered by Praxis. Note: This badge does not indicate the holder's status or eligibility as a certified educator in Pennsylvania.
0e681291-a7d4-48ac-9d59-3155e413c80a.name: Passed the PA 7-12 CS Certification Exam

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Badge holder has passed the Praxis Computer Science (5652) exam.

skills.name: Analyze behavior screeners to identify student needs.
Match student needs to evidence-based interventions and strategies.

c64b4448-859a-4093-8dad-6007fd52b0ff.description: Earners of this badge successfully engaged in the AEDY Team supported course "Building an MTSS Framework", including professional development on building an MTSS team, assessments, data analysis, building a core behavior support system, and the creation of lesson plans to explicitly teach behaviors using the behavior matrix. Teams who were enrolled in the course are committed to a continuous improvement of building a positive framework of behavioral supports through their MTSS structure.
c64b4448-859a-4093-8dad-6007fd52b0ff.name: AEDY MTSS Course for LEAs & Programs

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

Teams who were enrolled in the course are committed to a continuous improvement of building a positive framework of behavioral supports through their MTSS structure.

4c26f0d2-d558-445a-8244-ea78ff864bd3.description: Five module series focused on the integration of technology for students who are visually impaired.
4c26f0d2-d558-445a-8244-ea78ff864bd3.name: Summer Technology Institute for Supporting AT - BVI

937d6e99-ca45-4cc9-ac7d-cc52906fd833.description: Cross-disciplinary (Tier 3 Problem-Solving) teams worked toward the goal of understanding RTI methodologies, within the context of a sustainable and effective multi-tiered system and current research, and best practices in SLD Identification. Problem-Solving Teams continuously reviewed student Response to Intervention (RTI) and opportunities for families to be meaningfully engaged in the RTI process.
937d6e99-ca45-4cc9-ac7d-cc52906fd833.name: RTI Mini Series

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in series professional learning opportunities
Action plan for a sustainable district-wide MTSS model and RTI methodologies
Leverage data sources for decision making in a Tier 3 Problem-Solving Team
Implement evidence-based practices
Meaningfully inform and engage families

skills.name: Pennsylvania Standards-Aligned High Quality Core Instruction

ca1af7ed-7192-45dc-a1c9-4d565b1bc379.description: This series is for local education agency (LEA) teams comprised of school psychologists, administrators, and others involved with systems supporting the service delivery model for school psychology. The goal is to help LEAs make a substantial shift toward building necessary infrastructure and support for school psychologists to work effectively, efficiently, and equitably to deliver a comprehensive continuum of services. An emphasis is on prevention services to reduce adverse student outcomes.
ca1af7ed-7192-45dc-a1c9-4d565b1bc379.name: School Psychology: Comprehensive Service Delivery

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

alignments.name: NASP Practice Model Domains
alignments.description: The following domains, while described as distinct, regularly interact and intersect within the context of service delivery. The NASP Practice Model outlines how services are integrated to best meet the needs of students, families, and the school community (National Association of School Psychologists, 2020).

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a year-long series of professional development sessions focused on establishing necessary infrastructure and the provision of comprehensive service delivery in school psychological services.
Participate in customized consultation for respective school district / local education agency (LEA) to identify areas for expansion of school psychological services into prevention, based on data,

Develop and present a session to statewide teams about the district's / LEA's efforts to analyze available data sources, identify a domain of service delivery where school psychological services can expand into prevention, and how team members worked collaboratively to support expanded school psychological services.

skills.name: Apply resource mapping skills to prioritize areas of focus and to efficiently / effectively allocate resources
Describe 10 domains of comprehensive school psychological service delivery
Discuss practical strategies to support a comprehensive service delivery model for school psychological services
Identify data sources to evaluate systemic strengths and areas of need / focus for prevention efforts school psychologists can support

160ed033-8596-420c-9092-8c683a0e4001.description: This mini series is designed to assist teams of math teachers with adoption and implementation of a classwide math intervention to enhance core math instruction (Tier 1) for all students, including students with disabilities. Grade level teams of math teachers will have the opportunity to debrief with other grade level teams regarding outcomes on student engagement and math outcomes.
160ed033-8596-420c-9092-8c683a0e4001.name: Classwide Math Intervention | Grades 4-6

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all training sessions.
Use screening data to identify classwide needs in math.
Implement a classwide intervention to address classwide needs.
Assess the effects of the intervention.
Present implementation experience and outcomes.

086165e5-1602-4089-bbd6-4d6860df38bb.description: Grade Level Teams will implement classwide reading intervention with fidelity and capture the impact of classwide reading intervention on student outcomes.
086165e5-1602-4089-bbd6-4d6860df38bb.name: Classwide Reading Intervention | Grades 2-5

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all training sessions
Use screening data to identify classwide needs in reading.
Implement a classwide intervention to address classwide needs.
Assess the effects of the intervention.
Present implementation experience and outcomes

fb05deb7-dd7a-4584-8e3b-ed2029b789c2.description: Efficient assessment practices that easily link to interventions are a key practice in an effective multi-tiered system of support (MTSS). In this series, participants will use a variety of data sources (e.g., screening data, curriculum-based measurement data, and curriculum-based assessment data) in conjunction with the problem solving process to identify student needs and match them with appropriate, evidence-based interventions at the group and individual levels.
fb05deb7-dd7a-4584-8e3b-ed2029b789c2.name: Assessment for Intervention

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

alignments.name: NASP Practice Model Domains
alignments.description: Domain 1: Data-Based Decision Making; Domain 2- Consultation and Collaboration; Domain 3- Academic Interventions and Instructional Supports

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals who participated in this series supported at least one teacher with data analysis, intervention matching based upon data, and intervention implementation.

skills.name: Define and describe the stages of the learning hierarchy
Describe and list ways to troubleshoot and intensify interventions when progress monitoring data suggests interventions are not effective
Identify how to analyze universal and group level data and match them to interventions
Identify how to use CBM and CBA data to conduct diagnostic assessments and identify specific targets for intervention
Identify the elements of precise problem statements and how to collect data to inform precise problem statements
List multiple methods for interpreting progress monitoring data (aimline, ROI, trials to mastery, and SGPs) and data-decision rules for adjusting interventions
use CBM and CBA data to match interventions to the stages of the learning hierarchy

4ef3a177-2896-426a-8a6e-96dda412af3a.description: The Tier 1 Team Initiated Problem-Solving (TIPS) badge signifies that the earner has completed professional learning activities to facilitate the implementation of the TIPS framework at the tier 1 level.
4ef3a177-2896-426a-8a6e-96dda412af3a.name: Tier 1 Team Initiated Problem Solving Facilitator

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Have a role at the state, regional, or program level to build capacity in PBIS/MTSS. Have a role working with teams and coaches implementing TIPS. Goal of delivering TIPS training to instruct teams and District/Program coaches on the basic skills required for initial TIPS implementation and scale up. Have the ability to support teams in practicing TIPS meeting Foundations and use of the problem solving protocol, provide feedback, and understand data and data systems.

skills.name: and/or meeting observations to develop additional learning opportunities for building level team and/or District/Program coaches.
Attend 2 team meetings following TIPS team training to support implementation. (submit dates)
Complete and Submit TIPS Coaches Fidelity Checklist
Complete a TIPS team training within 3 months of completing TOT.
Provide written/verbal feedback regarding meeting minutes and use of data protocol. (submit short summary)

3c1cb60d-8e0b-46ba-adaf-6298b63decda.description: Middle school teams committed to a focus on fidelity of implementation of “Word Generation”(SERP Institute) across content areas coupled with evidence-based engagement strategies. Teams collected evidence of systems, classroom and student growth through a variety of assessments and student feedback.
3c1cb60d-8e0b-46ba-adaf-6298b63decda.name: “Word Generation” to Enhance Academic Language and Argumentation Skills Across Disciplines

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in series professional learning opportunities
Implement WG with fidelity
Adopt data-based decision-making to inform instruction and intervention via pre/post student data
Complete Presentation Template
Attend February 23, 2023 to share results and experiences

skills.name: Pennsylvania Standards-Aligned High Quality Core Instruction

0215c4d2-8759-4770-9582-824c191f9feb.description: This award recognizes outstanding K-12 computer science (CS) educators for their efforts to expand CS learning for all with the CSforAllPA Exemplary Educator Award.

9505bc57-5fc1-49e6-a0ae-48b5bc4ab6bc.description: This mini series is designed to assist secondary ELA practitioners with enhancement of core reading instruction (Tier 1) for all students, including students with disabilities. Teams of secondary grade level ELA teachers will implement a high-leverage core reading strategy with fidelity. Teams will have the opportunity to debrief with other secondary teams regarding outcomes on student reading outcomes.

List and apply strategies to support word study within instruction.
Teach strategies to support comprehension.

47543372-a625-4cc6-a898-52fe7d7339d9.description: The CSinPA K-8 Pathway supports participants in the development and implementation of a small-scale implementation pilot to expand CS access for students.The pathway includes 8 modules, where each module has 6 hours of activities.
47543372-a625-4cc6-a898-52fe7d7339d9.name: #CSinPA K-8 Pathway

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Access and use the K-12 Framework and CSTA standards
Initiate and reflect on a small-scale implementation pilot

Recognize and create a plan to close equity gaps in CS education, specifically for students with disabilities and other historically underrepresented populations, such as students of color and female students
Leverage community and stakeholder partnerships
Articulate the need for CS in education and our communities

749adea0-20c3-4138-b9ba-cdd808efea16.description: This series is designed to assist novice general and special education teachers with the design and delivery of effective lesson planning, implementation of high leverage universal instructional practices, and data-driven decision-making toward enhanced outcomes for all students, including students with disabilities.
749adea0-20c3-4138-b9ba-cdd808efea16.name: Designing and Implementing High Leverage Instructional Practices Series

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all sessions.
Cite current lesson planning practices and discern which practices are consistently implemented in their work setting.
Identify the three principles of Universal Design for Learning (UDL) and provide examples of instructional practices that align with each principle.
Integrate the principles of UDL into existing lesson planning practices.
Identify the resources and supports necessary to implement the integrated lesson planning.
Differentiate typical from universal instruction and give examples of how universal instruction could be integrated into their instructional practices.
Create evaluation rubrics to assess student learning within the context of the 3 Principles of UDL.
Describe sample fidelity measures peer teams can use to support implementation of universal instruction and integrated lesson planning.
Identify positive, questionable and poor response to instruction (academic, behavior, SEL) using data-based decision rules.
Identify specific, evidence-based instructional practices based on the specific type of response to instruction.
Explain the use of both types of decision rules in the context of their existing practices.
List resources and supports necessary to implement the decision-rule processes in their work setting.
Present implementation experience and outcomes.

c4c664cb-4cf7-458e-8b13-215b136108ff.description: This Tier 3 Problem-Solving mini-series is designed to assist cross-disciplinary MTSS problem-solving teams with enhancement of reading outcomes for students who are most vulnerable, including students with disabilities. Teams will understand the etiology and treatment of reading difficulties at the Tier 3 level, identify a student in need and proceed with mobilization of Tier 3 supports and services. Teams will present student progress after the implementation of intensive intervention.
c4c664cb-4cf7-458e-8b13-215b136108ff.name: Intro to Tier 3 Problem Solving & Case Study Analysis | Grades K-2

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all sessions.
Describe characteristics of Tier 3 and explain the need for a continuum of technically adequate assessment measures and empirically supported instructional methodologies.
Identify the characteristics of learner profiles related to oral and written language disabilities, dyslexia, and dysgraphia.
Create more sophisticated data-analysis and instructional matching skills.
Apply tenets of individualized problem-solving and align/integrate specific evidence-based methodologies matched to the need of a student who requires intensive problem-solving.
Present implementation experience and outcomes.

95ed82dd-5914-433c-9169-12964aee5f94.description: Earners of this badge will can describe the legal basis and requirements associated with psychological counseling as a related service for students with Individual Education Programs (IEPs). They can identify, through assessment, student need for psychological counseling as a related service, and the appropriate service(s) matched to need. Earners can describe implementation of services and how to monitor student progress.
95ed82dd-5914-433c-9169-12964aee5f94.name: School Psychology: Counseling as a Related Service

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Complete PaTTAN's Considerations for Psychological Counseling as a Related Service Schoology Course.
Submit evidence of application of skills.

skills.name: Describe how to use assessment data to identify the need for psychological counseling services
Describe the legal basis for providing counseling as a related service
Identify evidence-based practices that correspond to the various counseling services defined in IDEA
Identify progress monitoring methods for counseling services

01773f23-dfeb-4cd4-aa93-0da9c2348882.description: This session will support growth and understanding around self and peer assessment. Participants will learn the conditions necessary to increase both student engagement and achievement through planning and implementing peer and self assessment strategies. Experience the process of co constructing rubrics, using success criteria and learning targets, and then moving them into self and peer assessment structures.
01773f23-dfeb-4cd4-aa93-0da9c2348882.name: Secondary Formative Assessment | Peer and Self-Assessment Strategies

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all training sessions.
Experience the process of peer and self assessment.
Identify how the role of the teacher and the student change in this process
Connect the benefits of integrating rubrics, self assessment and Student Learning Objectives
Present implementation experience and outcomes.

78b361e9-eef7-4ba4-8598-9a10fb76f92e.description: This mini-series is designed to assist secondary grade-level teams with the enhancement of core instruction (Tier 1) for all students, including students with disabilities. Teams of secondary grade level teachers will implement specific strategies to enhance the use of high-leverage questioning and discussion techniques to facilitate student engagement and strengthen the overall health of core instruction.
78b361e9-eef7-4ba4-8598-9a10fb76f92e.name: Secondary Formative Assessment | Questioning & Discussion Techniques

issuer.summary: issued by Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

entity.name: Pennsylvania Training and Technical Assistance Network

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all training sessions.
Associate relationship between questioning & discussion with thinking & learning.

Practice evidence-based pedagogical moves, such as Academically Productive Talk, Socratic Seminar and Reciprocal Teaching and all-student response systems, to increase both student discourse and teacher assessment of learned content.
Articulate changes to be made in your own instructional practice.
Present implementation experience and outcomes.

33e26e2c-295b-482c-a92f-79542041ae41.description: This mini series is designed to assist secondary ELA practitioners with enhancement of core instruction (Tier 1) for all students, including students with disabilities. Teams of secondary grade level ELA teachers will implement a high-leverage macro-level writing strategy with fidelity. Teams will have the opportunity to debrief with other secondary teams regarding outcomes on student engagement and writing outcomes.
